content.raw:
Yes, I have been using bullet exclusively the past few days. It still feels weird to have an error message about a physics property within the rendering engine, especially since the rendering engine is used by both sensors and gui.

I would rather this functionality exist in the physics library, and/or as a tool that people can use to validate their models. Then we can check all the models with a command line script, and people who just link against libgazebo-physics can get the benefit of knowing their inertia values are incorrect.

Rendering should display what it is given without commenting on its physical validity. Think of the rendering engine as a library that doesn't know it's attached to physics engine.
